title: Manufacturing Activity Strengthens in October — Richmond Fed
text:
By Patrick Thomas

Manufacturing activity across mid-Atlantic states strengthened in October, according to a report from the Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond, as indexes for shipments, the volume of new orders and employment rose.

The Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond said the composite manufacturing index rose to 8 in October from negative 9 in September and 1 in August. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal expected a reading of negative 6 for the October period.

Positive readings signal expansion, while negative readings indicate contraction.

Firms reported growth in employment and wages in October and expected continued growth in the near term, according to the report.

The volume of new orders rose to 7 in October, from negative 14 in September. Shipments improved from negative 14 to 4 in October.

Manufacturers still struggled to find workers with the necessary skills in October and expected this difficulty to persist in the coming months, the report said.

The Richmond Fed district includes Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, the District of Columbia, Maryland and the bulk of West Virginia.
